  • Regressing the bending stiffness of a Bernoulli beam
    Oct 4, 2020
    • Gaussian process

    • differential equation

  • Gaussian processes for regression
    Oct 4, 2020
    • Gaussian process
    • regression
    • Bayesian methods

    The potential of machine learning models is sometimes mesmerizing, especially when we look at some cutting edge applications. But “the world ain’t all sunshine and rainbows”, sometimes things go a bit wrong, and all of the sudden your virtual AI assistant just spontaneously decides to throw a party at 2am, or to team with with your kid and buy some toys and cookies. That’s reason enough to not blindly trust whatever your ML algorith predicts, but instead to try to get a grasp on how certain we can be about it. One way of quantifying this uncertainty is through probabilistic ML models, and Gaussian Processes (GPs) are one of the best candidates for the task.




    • About this blog

    This is a collection of results that arise from my work at the Bauhaus-Universität Weimar. For questions or discussions, you can always find me here!
